definitions.definition: everything you can see when you look across a large area of land, especially in the country

examples.text: the woods and fields that are typical features of the English landscape
an **urban landscape**
the bleak/barren/rugged landscape of the area
The mountains dominate the landscape.
Rocks of all sizes dotted the landscape.
The power station dominates the landscape.
an urban landscape of factories and skyscrapers
the dramatic landscape of the desert
the need to conserve the rural landscape
The landscape of this region is dominated by two large volcanoes.
The impact of farming on the natural landscape has increased greatly.

definitions.definition: a painting of a view of the countryside; this style of painting
definitions.labels: (US English)(US English)(US English)(especially British English)(North American English usually)(British English)(North American English)

examples.text: an artist famous for his landscapes
She specializes in landscapes.
a landscape painter/painting

definitions.definition: the characteristic features of an area of activity

examples.text: We can expect changes in the **political landscape**.
Their songs altered the landscape of popular music.
The political landscape of the country has changed since unemployment rose.
We need to adapt more rapidly to the changing economic landscape overseas.
The magazine aims to provide a new perspective on the contemporary cultural landscape.

definitions.definition: the way of printing a document in which the top of the page is one of the longer sides

examples.text: Select the landscape option when printing the file.

definitions.definition: an object, especially an ugly building, that makes a place less beautiful

examples.text: The power station is a blot on the landscape.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (denoting a picture of scenery): from Middle Dutch lantscap, from land ‘land’ + scap (equivalent of -ship).
